TopicTitle: Contract: Plant a flag on Jool

Articles.Content:
Can this be done? If so, without losing one of my brave kerbonauts?

S

Edited July 23, 2014 by Storelem
Looks like a procedurally generated contract with a minor flaw in the coding (I say minor, if you even attempt this it'd be pretty major).

Looks like a procedurally generated contract with a minor flaw in the coding (I say minor, if you even attempt this it'd be pretty major).

Guess so.. although i have seen som youtube clips of people managing to plant flags. Its always a one way trip though. But how can you measure a kerbals life?
You could always just use the debug toolbar to get rid of the contract
There's no reason why it should be one way. Though admittedly, this is a pretty tricky contract....

Sorry, but planting flag on a gas gigant is a total nonsense.

Not a "tricky contract" as you call it.

Sorry, but planting flag on a gas gigant is a total nonsense.

Not a "tricky contract" as you call it.

You make it sound like nonsense in KSP is a bad thing.

Send Jeb, he'll be fine.

You make it sound like nonsense in KSP is a bad thing.

Send Jeb, he'll be fine.

hahahahaha! made my day!

badass jeb will do it even it's impossible!

It's techniqually possible, there are a few spots that you somehow can stand on.

But in practice, you have to get alot of variables exactly right and be very lucky to find those
Thanks for answers guys. I guess some kerbonauts will have to draw straws tonight

With an LV-N, a one way mission is possible with this ship

You will just have to determine if it is worth it to send a Kerbal on a suicide mission. After all, you can always decline to accept such a contract.

Thanks for answers guys. I guess some kerbonauts will have to draw straws tonight

I suggest you use unmanned probes to scout the 'surface' of Jool for locations that allow landing, and once you find one, note its altitude. Then, quicksave (recommended) and send your bravest Kerbonaut down in a ship capable of landing there (perhaps furnish for a layer of sacrifical landing parts?) and plant the flag.

Then hire Danny2462 to get your Kerbonaut back into space xD

With an LV-N, a one way mission is possible with this ship

http://i.imgur.com/NCZOsRY.jpg

http://i.imgur.com/cnkZ5nm.jpg

You will just have to determine if it is worth it to send a Kerbal on a suicide mission. After all, you can always decline to accept such a contract.

nice.. you got all the way down with no explotions and untimely deaths?

You could always just use the debug toolbar to get rid of the contract

Why not just press the red X button, which reads decline? You don't get any penalty declining offered contracts.

nice.. you got all the way down with no explotions and untimely deaths?

Nope, he fell through the surface and was crushed about 259 meters below the surface.
Hrm.. would it be possible to set hover rockets at 0-5 meters.. then step out , plant flag and step back in?
the kerbal will fall into jool. he cant plant anything on there where is no collision model.
